subject: Re: [junit] Re: Test Names for Parameterized Tests
msgSnippet: ... Robert, in Eclipse versions from 2.x to 3.2 test case that I ve posted here give you an error unable to find test method or something like that. About
messageBody:
Robert Watkins wrote:

>> I wish your statement would be true. Unfortunately it only work for
>>statically bound test cases. If tests are returned from the suite
>>method that is adding them dynamically (e.g. from external config or
>>captured data) in my knowledge none of the IDE would allow to restart
>>specific test case and you'll have to run the whole suite.
>
> Umm.... it works for me in Eclipse and in IntelliJ. I simply click on
> the failing test and select "Run".
>
> And I use the data-driven test approach extensively as well.

Robert, in Eclipse versions from 2.x to 3.2 test case that I've
posted here give you an error "unable to find test method" or
something like that. About 50% of its testcases fail all the time, so
you have quite good choice there.

I'd be very surprised if your Eclipse give you different result and
very much would like to learn how did you do that. :-)

Thanks

Eugene
